sub_title: Educational Administration / Athletic Director / Physical Education Teacher
summary:
PROFILE
- Over 30 years of leadership and teaching experience at international schools in Tanzania, Vietnam, Ethiopia, Cambodia, Azerbaijan, and most recently China.  Held various positions including Athletic Director, Department Head, Team Leader, and Afterschool Activities Coordinator
- Master’s degrees in Curriculum and Teaching, and in K-12 Educational Administration, Michigan State University. Bachelor's degree in Physical Education in The Netherlands
- Experienced in working closely with Leadership Team and Board of Trustees as Staff Representative, member Finance Facilities Committee; member Accreditation for Growth Steering Committee; chairperson Community-Home Partnership Group CIS/IBO Synchronised Reaccreditation Visit
- Professional development courses in Europe and the US: Principals' Training Centre for International School Leadership, Association of International School Heads, Loughborough University, Winchester Summer School of Physical Education, Perform Better Functional Training Summit
- Presented workshops at various international education conferences in Africa, Asia, and Europe

As a teacher, I always engage my students in activities that enhance their personal competence and self-confidence. My goal is to transfer my passion for lifelong fitness and instil in my students the value of effective teamwork and the benefits of an active lifestyle.  I am highly motivated and set high standards for myself and my students. I am proactive, innovative and well-organized.  These skills and qualities have greatly assisted me in initiating and organizing international sporting tournaments, charity runs, swim galas, and sports days, as well as in conducting online classes during the height of the pandemic. 
I have natural leadership skills, yet able to delegate and work well as a team member. I am known to be direct, yet sensitive and good-humoured. I am open-minded, sociable, and enjoy meeting and working with people from diverse cultures.  

I am a non-smoker and have taken part in half-marathons and triathlons, including finishing three 70.3 IRONMAN events.  With Dutch as my mother tongue Dutch, I am fluent in English, functional in German, and enjoy speaking French and Swahili. 

Over the past thirty-plus years, I have endured typhoons, floods, spells of malaria, days without water and electricity, and political unrest. I enjoyed "13 months of sunshine", swam alongside a whale shark and camped surrounded by lions in the great savannah.  I look forward to adding more unique experiences to this list as I embark on new and exciting challenges!

profile_positions.description:
- Founding staff member
- Head of Primary PE of a bi-lingual boarding school
- Developed and implemented IPC curriculum
- Trained and mentored national PE staff
- Organised swim galas and sporting events
- Coached after school activities (volleyball, badminton, track and field)
- UNICEF Lead Teacher
profile_positions.title: Primary School PE Head of Department

profile_positions.description:
- Developed and implemented International Baccalaureate Primary School PE curriculum
- Coached and mentored national staff
- Organised inter-house competitions
profile_positions.title: Primary School PE Team Leader

profile_positions.description:
- Developed and implemented International Baccalaureate PE curriculum. 
- Organised and coordinated students sport exchanges with international schools in the Caucasus Region.  Responsibilities included preparation of tournament budgets, planning travel logistics, tournament schedules, communicating and collaborating with various stakeholders to ensure smooth running of events.  This includes working closely with school administration, host families, PTA and parent volunteers, security and maintenance staff, referees, medical personnel, and visiting coaches and athletes.
- Collaborated with leadership team and contractors (architects, project managers) in the construction of the school's state-of-the-art gymnasium and multipurpose hall.
profile_positions.title: Athletic Director

profile_positions.company: ISPP - International School of Phnom Penh
profile_positions.description:
- Developed and implemented International Baccalaureate (MYP) PE curriculum 
- Initiated Inter-House sports competition and organised sports days
- Coordinated international students sport trips (basketball, softball, volleyball, soccer) and local sport competitions
- Organised and lead Week Without Walls trips (Kota Kinabalu, Borneo and Sumatra, Indonesia)
- Coached volleyball, football, and basketball to middle and high school students and took teams to international sporting competitions
- Initiated improvements of PE facilities. Due to my initiative, a roof was installed to cover the school’s basketball courts, providing much needed shade during regular PE classes and co-curricular activities; track and field facilities now better utilized by elementary and secondary schools   
- Committee memberships:  Finance and Facilities; New Facilities; PE and Health Curriculum Review
profile_positions.title: Athletic Director

company.name: International Community School of Addis Ababa

profile_positions.company: International Community School of Addis Ababa
profile_positions.description:
- Developed and implemented the school’s secondary PE program
- Oversaw improvements to sports facilities, including major renovation of school’s track and playing fields and gymnasium
- Prepared annual budget for the purchase of PE equipment
- Trained and mentored national PE staff
- Initiated and organized first ever participation of ICS in international sporting events with schools in Southern and Eastern Africa
- Initiated and organized fun runs for various charity organisations, such as UNICEF, Save the Children, and Concern  
- Organized and hosted numerous sporting events for the International Schools Sports Association of Addis Ababa (ISSAAA)  
- President of ISSAAA, 1998 – 2001; Vice President, 2001 – 2006
- Committee memberships: Accreditation for Growth (AFG) Planning Team; Facilities Committee; Staff Representative on the Board of Trustees
profile_positions.title: Athletic Director

company.name: United Nations International School of Hanoi (UNIS Hanoi)

profile_positions.company: United Nations International School of Hanoi (UNIS Hanoi)
profile_positions.description:

- Secured off-campus facilities (swimming pools, playing field, tennis courts, golf driving range, gymnasium)

- Responsible for all PE equipment orders and for the maintenance of sports facilities

profile_positions.title: PE Coordinator and After School Activities Director

profile_positions.description:

- Organized year-round sports competitions and exchange programs with local and international schools

- Coached various afterschool sports - volleyball, basketball, football
profile_positions.title: Secondary Head of PE

profile_positions.description:

- Trained and mentored national staff
- Coached afterschool sports - football, handball, hockey

profile_positions.title: Primary School PE Coordinator

volunteer_experiences.description: Organising Committee Member of Baku Triathlon
Coached Saturday football for international community.
Volunteer at the 1st European Games in Baku, Azerbaijan
Schoolboard member of the Dutch School, facilitating regular lessons in Dutch language and Dutch culture for families living in Addis Ababa.
